title: Ticket #2057: Always run POST script, even if PRE script fails
description:
To be more consistent, we should probably always run a POST script for a node if a POST script exists -- a motivating scenario is a PRE script that untars and/or creates a bunch of input files, and the POST script cleans up afterwards. Right now we do not run the POST script if the PRE script fails. We do run the POST script if the node job fails.

There should also be a config setting to get the old behavior, in case the new behavior would break some people's DAGs.

2011-Sep-5 by nwp:
With respect to #2122, we do not run the POST script if the PRE script returns the PRE_SKIP value.

2011-Jul-14 17:29:07 by wenger:
I haven't looked at everything yet, but here are comments on what I've reviewed so far:

Retries should not short-circuit the POST script! (In Dag::PreScriptReaper() the check for whether to run the POST script if the PRE script failed has to come before the check for node retries.)

When running the POST script, I don't think that job->_scriptPost->_retValJob should be set to DAG_ERROR_CONDOR_SUBMIT_FAILED (that means that the condor_submit command itself failed). I think that job->_scriptPost->_retValJob should be set to the return value of the PRE script.

The A test should delete the dagman.out file at the beginning.

The B test should check to make sure POST script was not run (in the failure subroutine).

There should probably be a test that combines this functionality with node retries.

I don't like the name 'NoPostRun' for the command-line argument -- it makes it sound like the post script will never be run. How about 'PostIgnorePre'?

Dag::ProcessJobProcEnd(), Dag::ProcessFailedSubmit() and Dag::PreScriptReaper() have pretty much duplicated code for running the POST script -- this could be broken out into a little method to avoid duplication.

This is a pretty important change, so it needs to be well documented. I can think of at least four places that need changes: 

  * The version history.
  * The configuration section.
  * The condor_dagman and condor_submit_dag man pages.
  * The main DAGMan manual section.

job_dagman_always_run_post-A and job_dagman_always_run_post-E fail for me; haven't dug into the cause yet.

2011-Aug-19 16:16:57 by wenger:
Okay, I was seeing the test failures because I had _CONDOR_DAGMAN_POST_IGNORE_PRE set to 0 in my environment(!). When I unset that, the tests succeed.

However, it looks like when _CONDOR_DAGMAN_POST_IGNORE_PRE is set to 0 and the tests fail, the PRE script failure in job_dagman_always_run_post-E is short-circuiting the node retries. (I'm in the process of making a test to check this out.)

2011-Aug-31 15:42:49 by wenger:
Just talked with Nathan about this. Given this feature, we think it doesn't make much sense for PRE_SKIP to run the POST script -- so I'm going to change that, and also do some hacking to try to clean up Dag::PreScriptReaper(), which has become pretty messy.

2011-Sep-01 14:07:44 by wenger:
Just found a new bug in this branch: If you have a node with a POST script, and DAGMan is then held while the POST script is running, when DAGMan is released and goes into recovery mode, it doesn't correctly deal with things and thinks the DAG is finished even though the node is not complete! I tested things with the 7.7.2 master, and that works okay, so it's definitely something in this branch.
